feat_req__example__some_title.content:
With this requirement we can check if the removal of the prefix is working correctly.
It should remove id_prefix (SCORE _) as it's defined inside the BUILD file and remove it before it checks the leftover value
against the allowed defined regex in the metamodel
Note: The ID is different here as the 'folder structure' is as well
feat_req__example__some_title.title: Some Title

feat_req__testing__some_title.content:
With this requirement we can check if the removal of the prefix is working correctly.
It should remove id_prefix (SCORE _) as it's defined inside the BUILD file and remove it before it checks the leftover value
against the 'allowed' defined regex in the metamodel
feat_req__testing__some_title.title: Some Title

stkh_req__index__test_requirement.content:
Some content to make sure we also can render this
This is a link to an external need inside the 'score' documentation.
:need:`SCORE_gd_req__req__attr_safety`
Note how it starts with the defined prefix but in UPPERCASE. This comes from sphinx-needs, `see here <https://github.com/useblocks/sphinx-needs/blob/master/sphinx_needs/external_needs.py#L119>`_
stkh_req__index__test_requirement.rationale: A simple requirement we need to enable a documentation build
stkh_req__index__test_requirement.title: TestTitle

stkh_req__testing__test_requirement.content:
Some content to make sure we also can render this.
This is a link to an external need inside the 'score' documentation.
:need:`SCORE_gd_req__req__attr_safety`
Note how it starts with the defined prefix but in UPPERCASE. This comes from sphinx-needs, `see here <https://github.com/useblocks/sphinx-needs/blob/master/sphinx_needs/external_needs.py#L119>`_
stkh_req__testing__test_requirement.rationale: A simple requirement we need to enable a documentation build
stkh_req__testing__test_requirement.title: TestTitle

tool_req__arch__attr_fulfils.content:
The tool shall enforce that each architecture element is linked to a requirement via
the 'fulfils' attribute/option.
tool_req__arch__attr_fulfils.title: Ensure Architecture -> Requirements Link

tool_req__arch__traceability.content:
The tool shall enforce that requirements are fulfilled by the architecture at the correct level.
This means:

* Feature requirements can only be fulfilled by: feat_arch_*
* Component requirements can only be fulfilled by: comp_arch_*
tool_req__arch__traceability.title: Ensure Architecture fulfillment links

tool_req__arch_diag_draw.content:
The tool shall enable the creation of a diagramm the following views:

* Feature View & Component View:
   *  Static View
   *  Dynamic View
   *  Interface View
* SW Module View
* Platform View
tool_req__arch_diag_draw.title: Support Diagramm drawing of architecture

tool_req__arch_linkage.content:
The tool shall allow and check for linking of requirements to specific elements.
In the table underneath you can see which requirement type can link to which other one

.. table::
   :widths: auto


   ====================================  ==========================================
   Requirement Type                      Allowed Link Target
   ====================================  ==========================================
   Functional feature requirements       Static / dynamic feature architecture
   Interface feature requirements        Interface feature architecture
   Functional component requirements     Static / dynamic component architecture
   Interface component requirements      Interface component architecture
   ====================================  ==========================================
tool_req__arch_linkage.title: Checking architectual requirement linking

tool_req__arch_security_linkage.content:
The tool shall enforce that requirements that are security relevant e.g. `security == YES` can only be
linked to other requirements that are also security relevant.

This shall be enforced for the following requirement types:

* Architecture
tool_req__arch_security_linkage.title: Restrict linakge of security architecture elements

tool_req__attr_description.content:
Each requirement must contain a non-empty description.

This applies to all :need:`tool_req__req_types`
tool_req__attr_description.title: Enforces presence of description

tool_req__attr_id.content:
.. (gd_req__req__attr_uid only covered together with tool_req__attr_id_scheme)

Need IDs must be globally unique.

.. note::
   Implementation note (in some sort of DR in the future??).
   IDs are unique within one docs-instance, this is guaranteed by sphinx-needs.
   Several docs-instances are always independent. When they are linked, they always
   receive unique prefixes for their IDs.
tool_req__attr_id.title: Enforces need ID uniqueness

tool_req__attr_id_scheme.content:
.. problem: how can requirements have a component name?

:parent_covered: YES

.. (together with tool_req__attr_id)

Need IDs must:

* Start with the need type (e.g. ``feature__``)
* Include the feature name (for feature requirements)
* Have additional text

This applies to all :need:`tool_req__req_types`
tool_req__attr_id_scheme.title: Enforces need ID scheme

tool_req__attr_impl.content: Source code can link to requirements.
tool_req__attr_impl.title: Supports linking to source code

tool_req__attr_rationale.content: Each stakeholder requirement must contain a non-empty ``rationale`` attribute.
tool_req__attr_rationale.title: Enforces rationale attribute

tool_req__attr_safety.content:
docs-as-code shall ensure that every element of type :need:`tool_req__req_types` shall have a automotive safety integrity
level (``safety``) attribute, which must be one of:

* QM
* ASIL_B
* ASIL_D
tool_req__attr_safety.title: Enforces safety classification (requirements, architecture)

tool_req__attr_security.content:
The ``security`` attribute must be one of:

* YES
* NO

This applies to:
* all :need:`tool_req__req_types` except process requirements.
* all architecture elements (TODO; see https://github.com/eclipse-score/process_description/issues/34)
tool_req__attr_security.title: Enforces security classification

tool_req__attr_status.content:
Needs of type:

* stakeholder requirements
* feature requirements
* component requirements
* assumption of use requirements
* process requirements

shall have an ``status`` attribute, which must be one of:

* valid
* invalid

.. warning::
   the architecture requirement does not talk about architecture elements, but about requirements.
tool_req__attr_status.title: Enforces status classification (requirements, architecture)

tool_req__attr_title.content:
.. "The title of the requirement shall provide a short summary of the description" is not toolable

Titles must not contain the words:
* ``shall``
* ``must``
* ``will``

This applies to all :need:`tool_req__req_types`
tool_req__attr_title.title: Enforces title wording rules

tool_req__attr_type.content:
docs-as-code shall enforce that each requirement has an ``reqtype`` attribute, which
must be one of:

* Functional
* Interface
* Process
* Legal
* Non-Functional

This applies to all :need:`tool_req__req_types`
tool_req__attr_type.title: Enforces requirement type classification

tool_req__covered.content:
.. link kaputt^^

:status: invalid

To be clarified.
tool_req__covered.title: Enables marking requirements as "covered"

tool_req__doc_attr_approver.content:
The tool shall ensure that the document header contains the 'approver' attribute.
This attribute shall be filled automatically and shall be the *last CODEOWNER APPROVER*
of the file that contains the document.
tool_req__doc_attr_approver.title: Document shall contain and the tool should fill approver attribute

tool_req__doc_attr_author.content:
The tool shall ensure that a document header has an 'author' attribute.
It furthermore shall implement an automatic way to deter Minn the authors.
Commiters with more than 50% of content addition, shall be considerd as author.
tool_req__doc_attr_author.title: Document author is mandatory and autofilled

tool_req__doc_attr_reviewer.content:
The tool shall ensure that the document header contains the 'reviewer' attribute.
This attribute shall contain all reviewers that are not mentioned under the 'approver'
attribute.
tool_req__doc_attr_reviewer.title: Document reviewer is mandatory and filled

tool_req__docs_tvr_safety.content:
docs-as-code shall ensure that every Tool Verification Report has a ``safety_affected`` attribute, which must be one of:

* YES
* NO
tool_req__docs_tvr_safety.title: tool verification report: Enforce safety classification

tool_req__docs_tvr_security.content:
docs-as-code shall ensure that every Tool Verification Report has a ``security_affected`` attribute, which must be one of:

* YES
* NO
tool_req__docs_tvr_security.title: tool verification report: enforce security classification

tool_req__docs_tvr_status.content:
docs-as-code shall ensure each Tool Verification Report has an ``status`` attribute, which must be one of:

* draft
* evaluated
* qualified
* released
* rejected
tool_req__docs_tvr_status.title: tool verification report: enforce status classification (tool verification report)

tool_req__docs_tvr_uid.content:
.. not sure about that satisfies link

docs-as-code shall support the Tool Verification Report (tool_verification_report).
tool_req__docs_tvr_uid.title: Tool Verification Report

tool_req__linkage.content:
The tool shall allow and check for linking of requirements to specific levels.
In the table underneath you can see which requirement type can link to which other one

.. table::
   :widths: auto

   ========================  ===========================
   Requirement Type          Allowed Link Target
   ========================  ===========================
   Stakeholder               Feature Requirements
   Feature Requirements      Component Requirements
   Workflows                 Process Requirements
   ========================  ===========================
tool_req__linkage.title: Enables linking from/to requirements

tool_req__metamodel.content:
The docs-as-code metamodel shall enforce process requirements.

.. note:: only process requirements which are fully covered by metamodel.yml are linked to this catch-all requirement!
tool_req__metamodel.title: Supports requirement metamodel

tool_req__metamodel_partial.content:
The docs-as-code metamodel shall enforce process requirements.

.. note:: once implemented, move the satisfies-links to tool_req__metamodel. This list contains not fully implemented or non understood requirements.
tool_req__metamodel_partial.title: Supports requirement metamodel (partially implemented)

tool_req__req_release_storage.content: The tool shall allow for a permanently saved release of the documentation as text documents including OSS tooling
tool_req__req_release_storage.title: Store releases

tool_req__req_saftety_link.content:
The tool shall enforce that requirements who have an ASIL_* **have** to be linked
against another requirements that have ASIL_* safety.

This shall be enforced for the following requirement types:

* Architecture
tool_req__req_saftety_link.title: Mandate links for safety requirements

tool_req__req_saftety_link_trace.content:
The tool shall ensure that requirements with safety != QM can only
be linked against safety elements.

This shall be enforced for the following requirement types:

* Architecture
tool_req__req_saftety_link_trace.title: Restrict links for safety requirements

tool_req__req_test_cov.content:
| Requirements shall allow for an attribute that shows if the requirement is covered by linked test cases.
| Allowed values:

* Yes
* No
tool_req__req_test_cov.title: Support requirements test coverage

tool_req__req_types.content:
dosc-as-code shall support following requirement types:

* Stakeholder requirement (stkh_req)
* Feature requirement (feat_req)
* Component requirement (comp_req)
* Assumption of use requirement (aou_req)
* Process requirement (gd_req)
* Tool requirement (tool_req)
tool_req__req_types.title: Requirements Types

tool_req__test_case_linkage.content: Docs-as-code shall provide a way to automatically link test cases to requirements
tool_req__test_case_linkage.title: Supports linking to test cases

tool_req__vis_ver_diff.content: The tool shall allow for two versions to be compared with each other and visualize the differences between those versions.
tool_req__vis_ver_diff.title: Enable visulisation of differences between versions

arch.description: Mapping of uml key to uml content.

constraints.description: List of constraint names, which are defined for this need.

constraints_error.description: An error message set if any constraint failed, and `error_message` field is set in config.

constraints_passed.description: True if all constraints passed, False if any failed, None if not yet checked.

constraints_results.description: Mapping of constraint name, to check name, to result.

docname.description: Name of the document where the need is defined (None if external).

doctype.description: Type of the document where the need is defined, e.g. '.rst'.

external_css.description: CSS class name, added to the external reference.

external_url.description: URL of the need, if it is an external need.

has_dead_links.description: True if any links reference need ids that are not found in the need list.

has_forbidden_dead_links.description: True if any links reference need ids that are not found in the need list, and the link type does not allow dead links.

is_external.description: If true, no node is created and need is referencing external url.

is_modified.description: Whether the need was modified by needextend.

is_need.description: Whether the need is a need.

is_part.description: Whether the need is a part.

jinja_content.description: Whether the content should be pre-processed by jinja.

layout.description: Key of the layout, which is used to render the need.

lineno.description: Line number where the need is defined (None if external).

parts.description: Mapping of parts, a.k.a. sub-needs, IDs to data that overrides the need's data

signature.description: Derived from a docutils desc_name node.

style.description: Comma-separated list of CSS classes (all appended by `needs_style_`).
